== KDE Guidance Power Manager ==

The power manager applet used by Kubuntu is Guidance Power Manager.  The binary package is kde-guidance-powermanager.  The source package, which will show up on launchpad, is kde-guidance.  Note that this is the same source package for several other Kubuntu configuration utilities.

Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  A potentially easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

Some good debugging information for power management issues can be found at <nowiki>[[DebuggingGNOMEPowerManager#head-a8d5bf53ac6011cf0e2301bc55eda548006205cc|the GNOME Power Manager debugging]]</nowiki> page.  Some more general information for working with KDE applications can be found at <nowiki>[[DebuggingKDE]]</nowiki>.

=== Bugs in New status ===
These are untriaged or not confirmed KDE Guidance Power Manager bugs.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''

*** Ask for more details, ask in #kubuntu-devel for details on what questions to ask (if you get some good answers, please start compiling a wiki page, starting at <nowiki>[[DebuggingKDE]]</nowiki>), change the bug's status to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself or
*** Try to recreate the bug in Hardy, document the test case in the description and change the bug's status to "Confirmed".
